boardgame.name: Shattered Cosmic Crystal Spaceship
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shattered orange and purple crystals coat this cracked metal spaceship, floating adrift within the Ocean of Night. Intact crystals cluster at the heart of the vessel, surrounding a glowing core with a control panel further back.
Entire rooms have been severed, drifting slowly apart from one another in the vacuum. Iron grates cover thick cables, while multiple rooms contain blank interfaces. What were once maintenance hallways lead into the surrounding empty space. Beyond is nothing but distant nebulas and chains of stars.

boardgame.name: Giant Turtle Submarine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blue crystals cluster at the heart of this submarine, built onto the back of a giant turtle. A glowing core shimmers, while a control panel with blue glyphs sits further back.
Iron grates cover thick cables, while multiple rooms contain more glowing interfaces interspersed with maintenance hallways and open spaces.

boardgame.name: Turtle Space Voyager
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blue crystals cluster at the heart of this spaceship, built onto the back of a giant intergalactic turtle. A glowing core shimmers, while a control panel with blue glyphs sits further back.
Iron grates cover thick cables, while multiple rooms contain more glowing interfaces interspersed with maintenance hallways and open spaces. Beyond shimmer distant stars and large nebulas.

boardgame.name: The Doomsday Machine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Red crystals cluster at the heart of this underground laboratory, carved into a remote mountain. Its glowing core shimmers crimson dangerously, while a control panel with glyphs sits further back.
Metal grates cover thick cables, while multiple stone or tiled rooms contain glowing interfaces, interspersed with maintenance hallways and living areas. Few know this laboratory exists, and even fewer are allowed to leave and speak of it.

boardgame.name: Magi-Tech Turtle Fortress of the Sea Pirates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blue crystals cluster at the heart of this sea pirate fortress, built onto the back of a giant sea turtle. A glowing core shimmers, while a control panel with blue glyphs sits further back.
Rusted metal grates cover thick cables, while multiple timber rooms contain more glowing interfaces, interspersed with maintenance hallways and living areas for the pirates. Outside seafoam churns from the ever-swimming turtle.

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dilemmas: Keep of the Blood Countess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Exsanguinated merchant families found dead, their homes stripped of all wealth. A mysterious benefactor leaving gifts for the poor. And rumors of activity near the sealed up old keep deep in the forest, stir barely forgotten memories of a countess, her demon child, and an act of mob justice.

Keep of the Blood Countess is a system agnostic adventure designed around the principles described in Dungeons & Dilemmas: The Dungeon as Narrative Framework and Encounters as Moral Puzzles. It is easily adaptable to your favorite adventuring game.

Content Warning: sex under false pretenses, pregnancy as body horror, and harm to supernatural children.

None of the above elements happen directly to the player characters whose agency around these issues is preserved throughout the adventure. It wouldn’t be much of a dilemma if they didn’t have a choice.

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System Core Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

The Core Rules has much to offer, but the Settings are the real meat of Erwinian. Each one comes with unique ancestries, races, species, occupations, skills and rules which flesh out the feel of the world. The Magic system in The Fantasy Setting is designed for total creative control with only a few guidelines, as is the computer program system in the Science Fiction Setting.

Erwinian has no levels and no point-buy skill increases; skills go up by small amounts by achieving a success after a number of failures. Each character has a Race/Species and Occupation which serve as “skill packages” for each setting. From there, any character can define themselves however they want. So long as it can be learned, the GM and players maintain a discussion about the character’s progress. Characters can learn skills not usual for their Occupation, or even develop new powers not covered in the original game. Erwinian is all about being able to organically and realistically develop your characters over time.

Since any skill roll in the game can be made as a d20 or d% roll, players can choose which one works best for them. Mechanically, Erwinian is a “roll under” skill system, where how low under your skill you roll determines your degree of success. Combat is based off of a blow-by-blow, potentially deadly system. Characters in combat can often handle themselves, but there is always that chance of things going suddenly very wrong using our unique critical hit system.

We hope that you enjoy this system as much as our friends and family have over the decades of play!

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System: The Science Fiction Setting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

The Science Fiction Setting was, like the Fantasy Setting, originally written in the 1980s and ‘90s, and has since been consolidated and touched up. What began as an homage to TSR’s Star Frontiers became an open and detailed system which can be easily adapted to the needs of the GM and players. This setting is designed for playing adventures in a science fiction future, either completely of the GM’s creation or using the samples provided in the book. Space travel, advanced weapons, medical wonders, and various alien species are the primary elements of this setting.

Characters in The Science Fiction Setting can take on various roles depending on what sort of future the GM wishes to run. They may be explorers traveling to distant stars, mercenaries hired to perform clandestine jobs for shadowy masters, scientists seeking to push the limits of known technology, soldiers partaking in a massive galactic campaign, or any number of galactic adventures!

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System: The Fantasy Setting
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

The Fantasy Setting is a basic layout for fantasy adventure in a classic world! Wizards and Mages weild deadly power, and mighty warriors do battle with razor-edged weapons. Creatures of the purest Good and direst Evil wander the world seeking to further their own goals. Powers both old and new strive in an eternal struggle over magical artifacts, forgotten lore, and ancestral lands. From there, the GM and players can expand their world into whatever direction they desire.

The Fantasy Setting's magic system is one of it's strongest points. Using only a few details for reference, players and GMs are able to create any spell they desire right from the start. Research time is based on a character's related knowledge and prior body of work. From there, the direction a magic-user takes is entirely unique and personal.

This setting book was originally paired with the Core Rules of the Erwinian System, as both were written over a Christmas vacation by it's creator, Eric Erwin, while he was in college. It was well-received by friends and family alike, and he went on to put together many more settings.

It has been a great pleasure to pick up the old notes and documents and make them available for players everywhere. From the Erwin Family and from the players who have helped us to fine-tune this game, we hope you enjoy the first Erwinian Setting.

boardgame.name: Hiding Hitler
boardgame.description: Hiding Hitler is a turn based card-game with a simple objective. End the game with the Hitler card in your hand or be the player to have eliminated him last. To achieve this goal, you will use a mixture of Action, Attack, and Instant cards. Action cards provide various utility methods such as drawing cards, stealing cards, or peaking into the deck. Attack cards are how a player attempts to eliminate Hitler. Instant cards are special because they can be played at any time. They can strengthen, weaken, or redirect an attack to another player. A turn consists of unlimited actions, unlimited instants, up to 1 attack and concludes with drawing a card.

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System: Realms of the Arcane
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

Realms of the Arcane is set during a time in human history when the march of industrial technology has begun to sweep across the globe. The Old Ways of magic and the unknown are fading away, leaving only pockets of sorcery in isolated places. Secret societies vie for power over each other and few remaining spots of “true magic,” and a few of the Old Powers sleep only fitfully...

Realms of the Arcane is a setting which combines elements of Eldritch horror, historical role playing, and secret society intrigue. Characters will often find themselves hunting down mythical creatures, exploring forgotten ruins deep in the wilderness, or working for secret societies hoping to gain influence.

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System: Nihimana
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

Nihimana is a post-apocalyptic setting akin to Mutant World. However, this world is both darker and harsher... Far in the future, after a near-total collapse of the planet’s environment, the surviving fragments of humanity were driven into a period of wandering savagery. After centuries of aimlessness, there arose a beacon of gleaming hope in all that burning waste; the City of Nihimana, the last fragment of the old world. Equipped with powerful renewable technology and protected from the worst effects of the shattered ozone layer, a new chapter in the dark history of humanity begins.

Characters might take on the rolls of “Pure” humans, who maintain a powerful grip on the city and its resources, or of Mutants, whose twisted sad forms dot the gutters of the domed city. Genetic disease and cancer plague all but the luckiest, and life of the downtrodden is cheap. Yet secret societies strive to gain power, seeking to turn the path of the future to their own designs. It is a time of change and survival in a cruel and harsh world, the few moments of honor and bravery shining all the brighter.

boardgame.name: The Erwinian Roleplaying System: Mutant World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is a multi-generational labor of love initially created by Eric Erwin and his father Jim in the 1980s, developed through the 90s and 00s, compiled and edited by his son Joseph in the 10s, and finally published in the 2020s. The project has grown to include Joseph’s wife Emma and his brother Emmett. Borrowing some core concepts from the OSR tradition, Erwinian has since evolved into something all it’s own.

The Erwinian Roleplaying System is designed as a universal framework which can be adapted to many settings, both pre-made or created by the GM. The system thrives on flexibility and creativity, with GMs and players being given the freedom to interpret the rules in their own way and develop new rules through creative discussion. Using the Core Rules as a jumping off point, they are encouraged to make their own spells, their own programs, their own abilities and so much more.

Mutant World began as an homage to TSR’s Gamma World, but swiftly evolved into an exciting and dangerous world of post-apocalyptic adventure all its own. Mutant World is set an unknown amount of time after a great cataclysm has destroyed the planet, shattering the super-culture which once dominated its surface. Those who survived did so by forming tribes and societies, slowly rebuilding the world over countless generations. Mutants, animal and human alike, have evolved to coexist alongside the New Humans, and new religions work to spread their faith. Much of the old world is covered under radioactive ash and years of soil, or drowned deep in the new oceans, but its touch is everywhere. Advanced technologies designed to operate for thousands of years can be found, and it is well known that whoever wields the power of the Ancients holds the keys to the new future...

Characters in Mutant World will be hardy survivors, mutants with deadly powers, or strange permutations of ancient creatures. Adventures will often take the form of defending settlements from dangerous mutant creatures, searching for ancient technologies in the unexplored places of the world, or embarking on missions to reclaim the frontier of a world that has long forgotten the touch of civilization.

boardgame.name: The Caravan - A Low Level Dai-suban Adventure
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A routine escort of a merchant caravan reveals something darker and more sinister. Will the players be able to put a stop to the encroaching evil?

Can be run as a standalone adventure, or as the beginnings of a larger orientally themed campaign.

boardgame.name: Campaign Resources: Nakano Dai-Suba Rules Supplement
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Campaign Resources: Nakano Dai-Suba Rules Supplement

For use with The Caravan - A Low Level Dai-suban Adventure.

Contains an expanded set of campaign details, house rules, new spells and items and background information for a Dai-Suban Nakanese themed campaign.

boardgame.name: Dai-Duba, Nakano Bestiary
Dai-suban Nakanese Bestiary
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A Dai-suban Nakanese bestiary created for use with...other Dai-Suban adventures.

boardgame.name: Wandering Spark
boardgame.description:
You are a Wayward Engineer, travelling from city to city doing odd jobs, living meal to meal and driven to keep going by a quest that gnaws away at you.

You are an Emancipated Android, released from the servitude you were built under, gathering new and wonderful experiences, making sense of the life you now lead.

Your journey together is a free-form jazz improvisation. Will your melodies harmonise, or end up as solos?

Wandering Spark is a micro-RPG inspired by the works of Shinichiro Watanabe, made for the Amor Ex Machina Jam. Tell the tale of an unlikely pair as they drift from place to place, in search of themselves, each other, and a secret yearning.

Playing as The Engineer is a different experience to playing The Android' - as the story unfolds, their relationships to each other and power dynamic will change. Whose dream are you really chasing?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Der Herr der Ringe Kompakt
Trivial Pursuit: Lord of the Rings Bite Size
boardgame.description:
This Trivial Pursuit Bitesize edition contains 600 questions about The Lord of the Rings, which are a challenge for even the biggest fans of Middle-earth. Take the handy travel wedge with you wherever you go, and use the special playing token in your boxed game at home!

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

boardgame.name: El Acantilado Sangriento
The Bloody Cliff
La Falaise Sanglante
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sole heir of Baron Solreigh was kidnapped, in the middle of the night, in the heart of the castle! The ransom letter is signed by Masked Harald, a thief, robber and benefactor of the poor.

His lair – The Bloody Cliff – is known, but would resist a frontal assault, which would also put the young heir in danger.

Bringing the Baron’s son back safe will require a very cunning plan...

The 17-year-old Pawel Solreigh, the only son and heir to the dreaded Baron Solreigh, has disappeared from his room in the middle of the night! In his place the guards found a ransom note demanding, in addition to a large sum of gold, a delirious reduction in the taxes on the barony’s serfs and peasants. It is signed by Masked Harald, the rascal, outlaw and self-proclaimed defender of the people – who justifies his insidious attacks and pernicious raids on the Baron’s tax collectors and convoys by redistributing the riches to the common people.

Harald and his gang undoubtedly hide with their innocent victim in their main lair, the Bloody Cliff; a rocky bar, impregnable by force without endangering the life of the innocent Pawel.

But no doubt some brave, astute and courageous Adventurers would be able to find the best way to bring Pawel Solreigh safely back to his father, especially given the handsome reward promised.

You will have to play it smart this time, as many surprises await the valiant Adventurers…

boardgame.name: Hardi
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hardi est un système de règles conçu pour animer des parties de Jeu de Rôle dans de nombreux univers classiques de Fantasy. Il ne décrit pas d’univers qui lui soit propre, mais propose par ses règles une teinte toute personnelle, qui viendra colorer votre univers de jeu favori.

boardgame.name: Altar Quest: Lurker Pack
boardgame.description: This Pack contains 12 new Lurker cards + miniature that were offered during the Fantasy Series 1 Kickstarter by Blacklist Games.

boardgame.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 2, Issue 16 - 2005)
boardgame.description:
Preview: L5R RPG 3.0

News of Rokugan
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

boardgame.name: Millennium Blades: Special Edition Playmat
boardgame.description: A Millennium Blades themed playmat designed for use with Millennium Blades or any other card game. Initially available as part of the Set Rotation Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: Millennium Blades: Collusion Special Edition Playmat
boardgame.description: A Millennium Blades: Collusion themed playmat designed for use with Millennium Blades or any other card game. Initially available as part of the Collusion Kickstarter campaign.

boardgame.name: Deal or Death
boardgame.description:
Deal or Death is the negotiation-focused social deduction game about corporate absurdity. Haggle and form coalitions in a series of fast-paced negotiations, while facing the constant threat of betrayal. As Executives attempt to secure the support of Shareholders by promising some coveted paperclips, Infiltrators with hidden agendas will do whatever it takes to fulfill their own ambitions. Who can you trust to make you rich?

After players draw their roles, the Executives shall identify themselves while the roles of the remaining players, known as the Board Members, remain hidden. Each Executive then enters a two-minute negotiation with every Board Member, offering Paperclips in exchange for information and support with the hope of closing Deals with Shareholders during the Board Meeting at the end of the game. Shareholders must decide which Executive to side with and close the most lucrative Deal, while Infiltrators disrupt negotiations with their own goals.

While negotiations are occurring, the other players are free to network, strategizing and scheming with each other. Before the Board Meeting begins, Board Members can discover someone else's role through a Disclosure (provided by Shareholder Tokens, Infiltrator Tokens, and VP Stars). Once the Executives finish negotiating with each Board Member, they may negotiate with one player for the second time in the Endgame Negotiations.

In the Board Meeting that follows, Executives and Shareholders shall submit Proposals, outlining the terms that they are committed to. Executives write down which of their Paperclips will go to who, while Shareholders write down their expected payout and which Executive they are supporting. Terms need to match in order for a Deal to close, but Executives may give more Paperclips than what a Shareholder asks for in their Proposal. Once they are done, players will reveal their Proposals and see who has closed Deals and who has won.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Central Supply Catalog
boardgame.description:
Finding the right tool for the right job can mean the difference between making the big score or gasping for air in the black of space. All the hardware the savvy captain needs can be found in the Central Supply Catalog, the fourth Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

These 60 cards provide new gear and ship upgrade options designed to support both contact and piracy decks!

Central Supply Catalog is not a standalone product. A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Two Player Starter Set

boardgame.name: Skinchangers Guidebook
boardgame.description:
In Skinchangers, you play an animal shapeshifter - Racoon, Crow, Owl, Bobcat, or Fox - created by the spirit of that animal type to root out the forces of desecration and fight the abominations that arise from it. The setting may remind players of Neverwhere, Werewolf: The Apocalypse, and a number of other urban fantasy settings (which were all absolutely in mind when creating it).

The system for Skinchangers is a variant of Schema. It uses a small fistful of either Fate dice or standard six-siders; some components of it may remind readers of the Redbox Hack, Apocalypse World, or Fate Core edition (because that's where those components came from, and proudly so); other pieces are relatively unique to the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Skinchangers Playbook
boardgame.description:
In Skinchangers, you play an animal shapeshifter - Racoon, Crow, Owl, Bobcat, or Fox - created by the spirit of that animal type to root out the forces of desecration and fight the abominations that arise from it. The setting may remind players of Neverwhere, Werewolf: The Apocalypse, and a number of other urban fantasy settings (which were all absolutely in mind when creating it).

The system for Skinchangers is a variant of Schema. It uses a small fistful of either Fate dice or standard six-siders; some components of it may remind readers of the Redbox Hack, Apocalypse World, or Fate Core edition (because that's where those components came from, and proudly so); other pieces are relatively unique to the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Rogue's Gallery
boardgame.description:
Life among the stars is not for the faint of heart, but the lure of riches and adventure draw from all walks of life. Nobles and scoundrels rub shoulders, while saints and sinners make common cause. On the mains, everyone has an agenda and no one is what they seem.

Rogue’s Gallery is the third Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game. These 60 cards have a special emphasis on new crew with higher cost and more potent abilities.

This is not a standalone product. A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Two Player Starter Set

boardgame.name: Skinchangers: Jarwick Lake
boardgame.description:
In Skinchangers, you play an animal shapeshifter - Racoon, Crow, Owl, Bobcat, or Fox - created by the spirit of that animal type to root out the forces of desecration and fight the abominations that arise from it. The setting may remind players of Neverwhere, Werewolf: The Apocalypse, and a number of other urban fantasy settings (which were all absolutely in mind when creating it).

The system for Skinchangers is a variant of Schema. It uses a small fistful of either Fate dice or standard six-siders; some components of it may remind readers of the Redbox Hack, Apocalypse World, or Fate Core edition (because that's where those components came from, and proudly so); other pieces are relatively unique to the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Orrery: Planar Adventures
boardgame.description:
Orrery is a system using Troika! backgrounds to generate characters, and which can be (and hopefully will be) used to play in the implied setting of Troika, but which otherwise is a completely different system.

Orerry is also a “build” of Schema, customized to this purpose.

To play Orrery, you roll a background in Troika, put it on an Orrery sheet, note a few things, and off you go. The Guide (Orrery's GM/DM/Etc) will use the setting material from Troika in whole or part, and away you go.


Troika is published by the Melsonian Arts Council; Orrery is an independent production of Levi Kornelsen and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Alles Wird Brennen
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The PCs awaken to the sounds of thunder and screams. Beyond the city gates, they see a wall of flames and horde of undead fast approaching. Can they escape the city before it crumbles in the inferno?

boardgame.name: The Demesne of Conflagration
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Within it, a flaming fortress of stench and grotesque hordes. Venture within before all blackens and burns. Free the Lich Queen Aoiva from unrepentant misery.

A MÖRK BORG dungeon crawl.

boardgame.name: Western Raider
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are alone. The Horde is coming. The kingdom will burn. You will rejoin. But for now, you are alone.

A MÖRK BORG class.

boardgame.name: The Ever-Burning Prophet
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An iconoclast of SHE descended from Bergen Chrypt in a fit of madness, the Ever-Burning Prophet rants and raves, spouting foul portents to all who will listen. Their zeal for SHE is matched only by the raging inferno which engulfs them, voracious flames punctuate their passionate proclamations.

The Ever-Burning Prophet is a heretical NPC for MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Crna Gora
boardgame.description:
A country of miracles and a treasure chest full of the worlds most wonderful jewels. It is as if the legend is true, that God's bag really did tear apart when he was providing gifts of nature, and beautiful things like the mountains fell out of the sky over Montenegro.
Geographers say that, although not large, this area in south Europe and the Balkans is unique for its diversity, and was created in ancient times by strong forces of nature.
Whether created by the forces or not, it has turned into something beautiful, unusual and magnificent!
If you enjoy spectacular nature, absolute relaxation and recreational activities, Montenegro is a place where you can experience a joyful energy. The country is great fun, providing adrenaline filled adventures and competitive thrills. You can find long and protected sandy beaches, providing thousands of kilometres of hiking and cycling trails as well as fast flowing rivers ideal for rafting and kayaking and superb ski paths.

Key Features

The world's best family board game brings you another exciting edition
Choose your favourite token, tour your favourite sites and accumulate fortunes, but watch out for taxes, jail and bankruptcy
Invest in houses and hotels and trade your way to success

boardgame.name: King of the West: The Mavericks
boardgame.description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West' card game set 2: The Mavericks, including The Marshall, The Bartender, The Wolf, and their locations.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: King of the West: Ghost Towns
boardgame.boardgameintegration: King of the West: The Banished
King of the West: The Vigilant
King of the West: The Banished
King of the West: The Vigilant

boardgame.name: King of the West: The Banished
boardgame.description:
There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West' card game set 3: The Banished, including The Reaper, The Phantom, The Shade, and their locations.

boardgame.name: Shot Tennis
boardgame.description: The board is a tennis court with holes in a grid of 4x6 for each half of the court. Players use small plastic tennis rackets to catapult cones into the court. Points differ by the area of the court the cones fall at, e.g. left and right service box is 5 points.

boardgame.name: La planete fantome
boardgame.description: Players roll dice and move robots on a circular board divided into sectors. The robot that reaches the planet in the center first wins.

boardgame.name: (DrSTONE)
boardgame.description:
The players becomes the characters of "Dr. Stone" and cooperates to achieve the purpose of each episode. There are many mysteries and surprises during the game, and you can solve them by combining materials and making equipment to find ways to achieve your goals.

It is a story driven cooperative game that can be enjoyed not only by those who watch the anime or read the manga, but also by those who haven't watched it.

The purpose of the game is to create a "goal item" in each episode within the time limit. In a world that has lost science, casual things doesn't seem to fulfill a purpose. However, with the knowledge of Senku and the cooperation of his friends, there is nothing impossible!

boardgame.name: Saviors of Hogtown And Other Adventures
boardgame.description:
Contained within are three Dungeon World funnels each designed to test the determination and bravery of three to six normal everyday folk in the face of abominable creeping evil.

The first, Saviors of Hogtown: Porcine villagers are called to rise above their station and save someone else’s bacon.

The second, The King Beneath the Castle: Simple townsfolk escape certain doom only to stumble upon a far more sinister danger.

The third, Shark God’s Chunder: A sleepy seaside town is thrust into chaos when a leviathan vows revenge.


Also included in this supplement:


Additional rules for playing lvl 0 Villagers in Dungeon World
Supplemental material to help you make the most of your adventure.
Tables for random mutations of Aspect & Form as well as a number of Occurrences at Camp.
Beautiful hand crafted art by the excellent Al Lukehart


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Rolling with Laughter
boardgame.description:
Rolling with Laughter isn't an adventure. Well, it is... I mean it not JUST an adventure. let me start over.

Rolling with Laughter is a high fantasy adventure but it is also a guide meant to show you, the GM, what turns an adventure into a comedy adventure. Each scene contains an explanation of its narrative purpose, a list of the comedic devices that are used to set up comedic moments and the expected outcome of the scene so you could easily improvise and build on any development while having an endpoint to aim to.

Rolling with Laughter can be easily run in any gaming system but is delivered with Dozens - A simplified few pages role-playing system specially designed for games that don't want the story to be bogged down by the mechanic.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Whip
boardgame.description:
A rather larger board game where players back lead token horses with evenly distributed game counters. One player acts as a banker. Horses are placed at the start of the track and move one square at a time if their particular number is rolled by a dice. The winner is the first to finish the race and the banker pays out on that horse. A player can also back a red or blue finish on the respective colour lanes.

The horse names represent English and Irish thoroughbred racehorses from the turn of the 20th Century. The horses were famous at the time for winning the prestigious races on the English calendar.

boardgame.name: Das Labyrinth
boardgame.description: The players start at the large space with the arrow. The first player to reach the large space with the black dot wins the game. Direction of movement is determined by a die. The players move 1 space per turn. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the the first meeple is returned to the starting space.

boardgame.name: 6th Sense
boardgame.description:
In the trick-taking card game 6th Sense, you score by correctly predicting the number of tricks you'll take in a round.

The game lasts 4-6 rounds depending on the player count. The deck contains cards numbered 0-14 in five colors, and at the start of a round players are dealt a hand of 11-15 cards, then the top card of the deck is revealed to designate a trump suit. Each player then simultaneously chooses a card from their hand to predict the number of tricks they'll win this round, then places this card face down on the table.

In general, standard trick-taking rules apply: Someone leads a card, and other players must follow suit, if possible, with the highest trump or highest card of the suit lead winning the trick. That said, some cards have special effects when played:

When you play a 0, you can treat it as a 0 of that color, or you can remove the 0 and one previously played card from the current trick.
A trick with a 4 in it is won by the lowest card played instead of the highest; a second 4 cancels this effect.
The 6 and 9 are on the same card, and you declare which value you want when playing it (or when using it to predict the number of tricks you'll win).
When you play an 8, you can peek at the prediction card of whoever wins that trick.
If a trick contains at least one 12, the trick's winner can choose to immediately split the cards in that trick to count as two tricks.


At the end of the round, if you've collected as many tricks as you predicted at the start of the round, you score that many points. If you failed to collect that number, you lose as many points as the difference between your prediction and what you collected, e.g., if you predicted 5 and collected 4 or 6 tricks, you lose 1 point. After the designated number of rounds, whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 5 consists of 220 new cards:

50 new Black Cards of questions
160 new White Cards of answers
10 blank cards (5 black, 5 white) for Your ideas.
This game is fully compatible with previous editions


About what is the game? Players draw answer cards to their hand. One person draw question card. In secret everybody add their answer and after shuffle everybody votes on the best/funniest/craziest answer card. The person with the higher number of votes wins the round and take the card to his players area as a point. Than everybody fill answer cards, and the winner draws another question card. You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.

—user summary

To pierwsza w Polsce dwujzyczna gra tekstowa tego typu, która umoliwia wspóln zabaw z anglojzycznymi znajomymi!

Pudeko zawiera 220 kart w tym:

50 nowych Czarnych Kart pyta
160 nowych Biaych Kart odpowiedzi
10 pustych (5 Czarnych i 5 Biaych) kart na Twoje pomysy
Pena kompatybilno z pozostaymi czciami


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Karty Dentelmenw: Epizod Szsty
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

This is the Sixth deck of polish spin-off CAH and the cards are 2 languages (Polish and English). It is playable by itself or can be combined with previous decks.

You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.

boardgame.name: Generation Y: Anders Leben! Anders Arbeiten! Anders spielen!
boardgame.description:
Generation Y is a new social game with a twist - you will use your smartphones and their features as playing field.


You are playing around the table with your smartphones
The game arena is online. A messenger-app of your choosing
Challenge yourself in over 45 tasks
Knowledge, talent, creativity and humour will bring you victory


Share your experiences and get a viral hit

—description from the publisher

Generation Y ist ein brandneues Gesellschaftsspiel mit einem innovativen Spielprinzip - ihr nutzt euer Smartphone und dessen unzählige Funktionen als elektronisches Spielinstrument.


Gespielt wird am heimischen Tisch mit eurem Smartphone

Wissen, Talent, Kreativität und Humor bringen euch den Sieg

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Porto: Promo Card
boardgame.description: During setup, give this card to the last player. On that player's turn, he or she may use this card as a Construction card of any color. When it is used OR if someone builds a roof, pass this card to the next player on the right.

boardgame.name: KOTH
boardgame.description:
The board is four concentric rings linked by connector lines. Each players place, move, or jump black or white tokens on the intersections. After each move, all connecting tokens are converted to the color of the active token. The game ends when a token is placed at the center of the circle. The player with the most tokens left is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: 3 Minutes to Freedom (or Death)
boardgame.description:
This is a short card game for 3-8 players that pushes players to speak and interact with each other in unusual ways, to keep the play entertaining.

Players use cards to force a variety of effects on each other. Many of these have conditions (e.g. "Dance like a sheep for 10 seconds. If you don't, you die.") that must be fulfilled to not be eliminated from the game.

The last player remaining is the winner.

boardgame.name: Gussy Gorillas
boardgame.description:
Gussy Gorillas are a peculiar group of primates that strive to keep each other gussied up and well-groomed. Through social grooming, these apes remove dirt, insects, and debris from the difficult-to-reach and difficult-to-see places of each other’s fur. Reciprocation is expected and awarded in this kind of monkey business! The player who acquires the most diverse and exotic collection of groomed goods will earn the respect of their fellow primates and be awarded the golden banana of victory.

In Gussy Gorillas, players start out with a personal deck of face-down cards. Without looking at the card(s) in their hand, players simultaneously trade or keep their hand, one or two cards at a time, to form a personal collection. Once all cards have been traded or kept, players tally their collections and the highest score wins — but pairs can cancel out and special cards are not always helpful, so trade carefully!

Similar to the popular game Hanabi, in Gussy Gorillas players hold their cards facing away from themselves...but instead of being a co-operative memory game, this is a competitive negotiation and bluffing game. Things get even more interesting once players realize that every card can either be very good or very bad for one's collection, depending on the context. You'll have to convince your opponents to keep bad cards for themselves and give great cards to you if you want to swing away with the win...

—Description from the Publisher

boardgame.name: New Techno War
boardgame.description:
In today's world, where security is a daily challenge and terrorists and serious crime cross borders, having a modern, mobile and flexible army is of paramount importance.

In New Techno War, you will take command of a modern military troop, based on the doctrine of a real army of today, with its equipment, vehicles and real firepower.

In serious scenarios, based on real facts, but also on original and amusing adventures, you will be able to test your tactics to achieve maximum success in a mission.

In order to optimize your chances, this game proposes to introduce into the troops modern technologies, still in test phase, or non-existent. These extensions should allow you to refine or even reinforce your actions. In the basic box, you will already find the new technology of the exoskeleton.

boardgame.name: Lusty Odyssey
boardgame.description:
The latest western fantasy RPG masterpiece is here with a storyline with more than 1 million words!!

With the exciting and arousing Secret system, why just lie in bed counting sheep at night when you can enter Lusty Odyssey to check out the little secrets of the girls in bed♥

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Rome & Roll: Pantheon Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A promo card available from the BGG Store, 2021.

Pantheon is a Religious Building card.

Build: Build entirely on a hill. Max 1 per Hill. Gain a God's Favour.

Production: Pay 1 Jewellery or 1 Anvil to gain either 2 Coins, 2 Legacy or 1 Senator.

boardgame.name: Galix in Mnchen
boardgame.description:
Players move on given tracks through the City of Munich to collect 7 different cards on 7 special places. After each move you are asked a question (multiple choice) about Munich. If the answer is correct you earn extra movement. If you meet another player's pawn on the track, you send him back to his starting point.

The Player to be the first on to collect 7 different Cards, wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche Mnchen

boardgame.name: A Little Wordy
boardgame.description:
From the award-winning, best-selling creators of Exploding Kittens and Throw Throw Burrito, A Little Wordy is a fresh and ridiculously clever take on the genre of tile-based word-unscrambling games.

Here’s how it works: You’re each given a pile of letters. Rearrange your letters until you come up with a word. Be sneaky and choose a word that your opponent won’t easily guess.

Write it down, keep it a secret. Rescramble your tiles, pass them to your opponent. The goal is to examine your opponent’s tiles and try to figure out their word. You do this with Clue Cards. These tell you things such as: what’s the first letter, how long’s the word, or what does it rhyme with? You win by using as FEW of these clue cards as possible to figure out what word your opponent wrote down.

It’s thoughtful, strategic, highly-replayable, and built specifically for two players. It’s not a game about having the mightiest vocabulary - it’s a game about making clever choices.

The longest, most complicated word isn’t always the best choice. Sometimes, picking a smaller, common word is better because your brainiac opponent will overthink things and blaze right past it. Trying to figure out your opponent’s secret word can be both hilarious and (delightfully) maddening. A Little Wordy levels the playing field against veteran word wizards.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: SUPPLY LINE
boardgame.description:
A one- or two-player card-based wargame.

There is always one common element between adjacent cards, and when you put them together, the connected elements activate each other.

As you collect these cards in your hand, you combine them to form units to fight for the 11 frontline cards of the two armies lined up in one dimension. The cards in your hand, when lined up and tabbed, create attack power and special effects, so they must be "exactly" the same as either the temporary "repel" value, which makes the front line temporarily yours, or the "dominate" value, which gives you complete control of the front line, making it impossible to ever get it back, and which you can use as a new weapon repeatedly.

The elements are divided into four categories: Land, Sea, Air, and Supply. The Army can only attack frontline cards adjacent to their own territory, while the Navy can only attack blue frontline cards with an anchor symbol. Because of the restrictions on the attack range of the army and navy, you can't attack deep into enemy territory very well, so you must first "repel" the middle of the enemy's front line with auxiliary range enhancing effects from the air force and supply operations to convert it into your territory.

The designer notes that the game's cards were inspired by Dobble/Spot-It.

boardgame.name: Sunny Day Sardines
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Sunny Day Sardines cannery! Competition is tough for the coveted Employee of the Month Award. Do you have what it takes to gather fish and pack the most orders? If so, then you’re hired!

Sunny Day Sardines is a fun and quick pocket sized game where players take turns gathering sardines and using them to complete orders for points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins and is named the Employee of the Month at the Sunny Day Sardines cannery.

This travel size game even comes in a metal tin! Sunny Day Sardines is a family fun game with easy to learn rules suitable for all ages.

Game play is quick to explain and get right to playing. Let's find out how:
On a player's turn they can do one of two things: collect two fish from the market (two different single fish cards or one double fish card) OR turn in fish they've already collected to complete order cards from the display. Players will take turns until the last order card is placed into the display, then finish the round. Most points from collected order cards wins!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Deadeye Dinah
boardgame.description:
In this in-hand solitaire Western campaign game, bounty hunter "Deadeye" Dinah Reeves is taking down a ring of crime bosses as a favor for her lawman little brother. Aim impossible shots, brave fearsome perils, and stretch scant supplies in your hunt to bring in each crime boss, dead or alive (most likely dead). As you progress, your legend will grow, striking fear into your enemies and granting you an edge...which you'll need, 'cause you've set your sights on the toughest, meanest pack of varmints this side o' the Wild West. Good thing you never miss.

Deadeye Dinah features an in-hand, cards-only microgame campaign with 8 unique missions, each lasting 4-6 encounters, and persistent character progression through each mission. Each mission, or "job," is hunting down 1 crime boss.

Players start a job by setting up the deck for the boss they want to pursue. To track down the boss, they play kit cards (Dinah's equipment) to overcome each scene card (the trials she faces) stacked on top of the boss card. A scene card can be an environmental peril or a shootout with hired thugs. Each kit card is played as either a bullet to shoot or an item to use for special effects, but playing kit cards also leaves Dinah open to being shot and losing cards. If Dinah overcomes a scene, the player adds the scene card to Dinah's kit cards. If she can't overcome the scene, she must escape and lose cards. If Dinah ever runs out of kit cards, and the player can't add any more, she fails the job and must start over.

If Dinah overcomes all the scenes and reaches the boss, she must duel the boss by playing a bullet to shoot the boss while avoiding getting shot herself. If she doesn't fulfill both those conditions, the boss slips away and Dinah fails the job. But if both conditions are fulfilled, Dinah wins the duel, captures the boss, and completes the job, earning reputation in the crime ring's new territory. As Dinah earns reputation, the player upgrades her legend effect, a passive benefit she carries into each job.

This game was first published as an entry in the 2021 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest, where it won several awards:


#1 Best Solitaire Game
#1 Best Original Artwork
#1 Best Cards-Only Game
#2 Most Innovative Mechanism
#3 Best Overall Game


-description from designer

boardgame.name: Terra Proxima
boardgame.description:
On the verge of extinction, after years of conflict that has left their planet nearly depleted of its natural resources, the inhabitants of this world have no choice but to leave their home. They’ll accomplish this by using advanced long range spacecraft to journey to the nearest habitable world that will become their new home.


Still stubbornly divided after decades of fighting, the remaining world powers now engage in a final surge for dominance and self preservation as they race ahead to their objective. As time runs out, they now must make a hasty departure from their dying planet. In order to complete their mission, they must obtain the materials necessary to sustain themselves, maintain their spacecraft, and research the science required to navigate their way through the long and dangerous journey that awaits them. In an ironic twist, they may be forced to cooperate with one another while still protecting their own interests. Now the ultimate strategic gamble for survival will require you to be the first to arrive and claim the distant world TERRA PROXIMA...

Terra Proxima, by Bavarian Games, is a push-your-luck, resource management game that will keep you on the edge of your seat throughout gameplay! It’s intense enough to keep experienced gamers excited, but simple enough to be enjoyable regardless of a player’s skill-set! In Terra Proxima, players will travel to different Moons and Planets to gather necessary materials and research the science in order to continue their journey towards Terra Proxima at the center of the board. The first player to arrive on Terra Proxima is the winner of the game. Will you be able to get there first?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Let's Get Kraken
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The fishing town of Ostin on the south shores of Kadalon Bay is under attack! A massive tentacled beast, a mighty kraken even, has been attacking the fishing boats. Can a band of heroes arrive to save them from this threat?

Let’s Get Kraken is an adventure for 2-6 characters levels 5-7 that pits them against a kraken … no, really: they go up against a monster so powerful our heroes are mere fleas. There is hope, for a mad sorcerer bent on revenge is controlling the kraken. Stop him, stop the kraken. The kraken is not the only great beast in the sea, and the massive Island that Dreams can be awakened, if the characters can find the right ritual and perform it. Summon your own gargantuan beast, battle a mad sorcerer, explore the Wievin Strip and the town of Ostin. Sounds like … an adventure!

Time to get started: Let’s Get Kraken!

boardgame.name: Junior Pictionary Mania!
Pictionary Mana Junior
boardgame.description:
Pictionary Manía Junior is a fast-paced game for the kids in which a player must draw an object while doing another fun activity and his teammates must guess what does the picture mean.

Game Mechanics:
The drawing and the colors of the category cards indicate: (1) The way in which the artist will try to let the playmates guess the word or concept drawn, and (2) Which word on the card is to be drawn.

Category description:

Normal game option.
The world upside down: draw the object turned upside down.
Opposite hand: draw with your opposite hand.
Eyes that do not see: draw with the eyes covered.
Musical drawings: while you draw, you must hum a song.
On the limp: lift one of the two legs while you draw.


In addition, there are the "Everyone plays" special event boxes.

End of the game:
The game ends when a team reaches the "Winner's Circle" in the center of the board and manages to complete 3 of the 5 category tiles it contains.

—user summary (English)

Pictionary Mania Junior es un trepidante juego para niños en el que un jugador debe dibujar un objeto mientras hace algo divertido y sus compañeros tienen que intentar adivinar lo que significa el dibujo.

Mecánica de juego:
Los dibujos y colores de las tarjetas de categoría indican: (1) La manera cómo el dibujante tratará de que sus compañeros de juego adivinen la palabra o concepto dibujado, y (2) Qué palabra de la tarjeta toca dibujar.

Descripción de categorías:

Opción de juego normal.
El mundo al revés: dibujar el objeto al revés (por ejemplo, una casa con el tejado abajo y el suelo arriba).
Mano contraria: dibujar con la mano contraria.
Ojos que no ven: dibujar con los objetos cerrados.
Dibujos musicales: mientras dibujas, debes tararear una canción.
A la pata coja: levanta una de las dos piernas mientras dibujas.


Además, existen las casillas especiales de "Todos juegan".

Fin de la partida:
El juego finaliza cuando uno de los equipos llega al "Círculo del Ganador" en el centro del tablero y consigue completar 3 de las 5 fichas de categoría que contiene.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Skully
boardgame.description:
Fate has bestowed Skully a second chance at life when an enigmatic deity reanimates the skull through the power of magical clay after it washes upon the shore of a secluded isle. Skully must hop, skip, and roll through this diverse island habitat teeming with obstacles and puzzles to intervene in a feud between the deity’s three siblings whose quarrel jeopardizes the place they call home.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Simulacra 2
boardgame.description:
Maya, an upcoming influencer has been found dead, and an obsessed detective suspects foul play. Her phone appears to be intentionally wiped, and her cause of death seems... unnatural.

You are given her phone to conduct an unsanctioned police investigation, and piece together the mystery surrounding her death. Solve the case before whatever happened to Maya... happens again.

Source: The Developer Website.

Publisher Blurb:

What's So Cool About Being a Librarian? is a hack of Jared Sinclair's What's So Cool About Outer Space?

Some Librarians chase all over the world, scooping up magical artefacts and saving reality.

You are not that sort of librarian. You deal with books. Often overdue ones. And library visitors.

To play the game, you will need at least two six-sided dice (d6) and preferably more than two and some way of writing down your character, whether on paper or electronically.

boardgame.name: FAB: Dubno '41
boardgame.description:
Fifth installment in Rick Young’s Fast Action Battle Series.
FAB turns East.

The time is set for Operation Barbarossa and the greatest tank battle of all times: more than 3.000 Soviet and nearly 700 German tanks and assault guns will clash in Soviet occupied Southern Poland. Known as the Battle of Brody-Dubno-Lutsk, that bloody triangle saw the direst straits of invading German forces in Barbarossa as they struggle for a week to repel the massive Soviet armored counterattacks to the flanks of the spearhead formed by Ewald Kleist's 1st Panzergruppe.

German invasion force was aimed towards Kiev and the Kiev Special Military District was the better armed and prepared of all Soviet Fronts stationed on the Westerns borders of the URSS, with a full array of Soviet Mechanized Corps, equipped with hundreds of the new brand tanks KV and T-34.
As the German player you control two powerful German armies: 6th and 1st Panzergruppe. The Soviet player will control the Northern flank of the Southwestern Front –formed by the 5th and 6th all arms armies. Blocks are mostly divisions with some regiments/brigades and German Kampfgruppen.

In DUBNO’41 you will see, with a minimum of new rules, the Soviet unpreparedness for war in June 1941 as they desperately struggled for defeating the German invaders. Soviets had a huge amount of low quality units with powerful but fragile armored forces against the Wehrmacht at its peak of quality and efficiency. Not a one-sided battle as someone could think about Operation Barbarossa but the Soviets could accomplish their mission and defeat or at least stop the invaders. The game includes assets for minor but powerful German units as the elite 652nd Panzerjaeger battalion or the scarce panzer grenadiers units fully equipped with armored carrier vehicles, heavy artillery, anti-tank units, the all-known 88’s cannons and more. Events include Soviet extra-hard KV and T-34 tanks, flamethrower tanks, air attacks, Soviet mechanical breakdowns and political officers and more…

German swiftness and tactical ability is opposed to Soviet mass and technological advantage. Weirdly not a single Stuka plane would arrive to help the German forces as Army Group South was not equipped with that type of aircraft. Soviet Air Force will fight one of its more desperate battles adding considerable strength to Soviet ground attacks. Will you pierce the Soviet lines and breakout towards Kiev, or you would slow the German advance and counterattack successfully defeating the invaders?

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Fishhunter
boardgame.description:
A few anglers are trying to catch the best fish. But somehow your choice of place doesn't seem to be the best to reach the jumping fish.
Fill your fishing net with the best fish before your fellow players do!

Each player receives a game piece and a fishing net. The lake is placed in the center. 5 phases are played. First you draw 2 tiles from the bag. Then you can put one or both tiles back into the bag and draw again. However, this costs one tile from the net. This can be repeated as often as you like.

After that, one tile is placed in the lake based on its coordinates. The other tile is turned over and serves as a time unit. The time unit can also be exchanged in phase 4 for giving up a tile from the fishing net.

In phase 5, fishing takes place. For each time unit, you may take one step around the lake and cast your fishing rod. Reeling in does not cost a unit of time. You may only cast straight ahead, so you must stand at right angles to the fish. Then the start player marker is passed on and a new round begins.

In the 3-4 player game, you can save time units and use them later. If a player's net is full, the current round is still played to the end, followed by the scoring. You add up the points of the fish on the fishing net. Who is the best angler?

boardgame.name: Axis Mundi
boardgame.description:
Axis Mundi is a 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate) mythological-space themed game, in which each player commands one of four worlds: Olympus, Takamagahara, Asgard and Kukultan.

The goal of each player is to become the AXIS MUNDI - the axis of the world - of the intelligent and primitive civilizations of the worlds that populate the galaxy. In this way they will be the hegemonic culture of the galaxy.

A game consists of twelve turns. The game ends at the end of the twelfth turn.

In each turn, each player may perform up to three consecutive actions.

Actions allow movement and combat, the occupation of planets, the exploitation and regeneration of their resources, the deployment of combat units, and the development of one's own civilization on occupied planets.

A player wins if he has more controlled planets than the rest of the players at the end of turn twelve.

—description from the designer (translated)

AXIS MUNDI es un juego de temática mitológico-espacial 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate), en el que cada jugador dirige una de estos cuatro mundos: Olimpo, Takamagahara, Asgard y Kukultán.

El objetivo de cada jugador es convertirse en el AXIS MUNDI –el eje del mundo- de las civilizaciones inteligentes y primitivas de los mundos que pueblan la galaxia. De este modo serán la cultura hegemónica de la galaxia.

Una partida consta de doce turnos. La partida finaliza al concluir el turno doce.

En cada turno, cada jugador podrá llevar a cabo hasta tres acciones consecutivas.

Las acciones permiten el movimiento y combate, la ocupación de planetas, la explotación y regeneración de sus recursos, el despliegue de unidades de combate, y el desarrollo de la civilización propia en los planetas ocupados.

Un jugador gana si consigue más planetas controlados que el resto de jugadores al finalizar el turno doce.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Twisted Game Of War
boardgame.description:
A fun, fast-paced medieval game that will keep everyone on the edge of their seat to see who will be crowned victorious. The game was made to be great for road trips and to unexpectedly lose friendships along the way. Be ready for anything as y'all take charge at one another with various and unique cards..... while you are getting yelled at of course!

When playing:


Everyone takes charge with their deck of cards.
All players then dual at the same time.
Depending on the cards players play, (The type of weapon or the type of armor) the outcome could give you up to four cards or even return them to their rightful owners.
The last defending player standing will be crowned VICTORIOUS!


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kaiserreise Wilhelm II
boardgame.description:
This is a redux of a variant of the renaissance-era Game of Goose (1587) which was themed around the era of Kaiser Wilhelm II and created around the year 1888.

According to the German designer Gerald H Kuhlmann, this appeared to be aimed at appealing to supporters of the Hohenozollern dynasty as they transitioned to the reign of young ruler who took his Grandfather's place and inspired hope of generational change.

In this game, 2 to 7 players rely on dice results to move their pieces around a spiral track toward the middle. The player who arrives first receives the tokens placed there at the start. Along the way, special space actions lead to special events, payments or profits.

When that end is achieved each player receives the tokens on the space of the monarch which was their hidden choice at the start. If players have chosen the same the rewards are split evenly. Any unchosen monarch's tokens are then also distributed evenly.

After all of this, the player with the most tokens (money) wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: ARSENAL: A LIGHT Module
boardgame.description:
WAR IS ETERNAL


To achieve peace one must prepare for war and the Beacons are prepared by the most advanced weapon manufacturers the Evening Era has to offer. Companies based on the concepts of the old world and driven by the demands of the new. Technomantic weaponsmiths hammering engram into lances to pierce the dark with slogan prayers on their lips.



A collection of tactics and weapons for LIGHT by Spencer Campbell.


Shine bright, Beacons!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Mortagh Collector of Souls
boardgame.description:
This module is for the occasion when a player must leave the party. Designed for the Game Master and a departing party member, together you will orchestrate a magical and visionary setting, allowing for the character to recount their adventures with their friends one last time - to say an unexpected goodbye - before setting off into the night.

MOOD: heavy & sentimental; Ladyhawke

It is strongly suggest the GM and player review the material and coordinate the one-shot together.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Firestorm Campaign Overlord
boardgame.description:
Firestorm Campaign – Overlord

This campaign is designed to be flowing where the Generals take command from Round 1 and through the supply and reinforcement build-up, make strategic decisions around capturing key ground, denying enemy exploitation routes or attempting sweeping flank attacks. A deliberate inclusion in this game is the full use of Warriors as additional firestorm units; both Allied and German. They can often be the key to an unlikely victory!

Generals have much to ponder, they have to:

Consider how to manage build-up of Allied reinforcements given finite supply availability and congestion around beaches
Placement of Mulberry Harbours
Impact of channel storms experienced in Round 3
Interdiction of German supply routes
Exploitation
And much more…


The campaign has two distinct phases:

Phase 1. D-Day 6 June. Played as a series of ‘Hit the Beach’ and ‘Seize and Hold’ missions. These are described in the handbook and should be adapted to suit local situations. There are two options for the impact of these games on the main tournament or second phase.
Phase 2. Main Tournament. Designed to be played over five rounds and each round comprises a week culminating in the fifth week post invasion from 7 June to 15 July.


The handbook contains all the special rules developed for this game including:

Firestorm reinforcement for both sides
Weather effects
German scattered defenders
Game flow
Game charts
Terrain effects
Town and area defences
Suggested tournament player packs


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Miraculum
boardgame.description:
Thousands of years ago, the Book of Eternity was placed on a bridge with four sacred guardians of white and black magic to defend the balance between the forces of good and evil.

The magic that emanates from the book has sparked an ambition among its guardians who now struggle to the death to reach it and be the holder of the power of the book.

Choose your side and help the guardians to take possession of the Miraculum, the Book of Eternity.

Miraculum is a quick game based on the throw of dice to be played in pairs (2x2) or in duel mode (1x1), where you will have to choose between defending white magic or black magic.

You and your opponents will fight to the death to be the new holder of the holy book, the Miraculum.

Each turn, you will have to combine the result of your dice to be able to cast spells to attack, protect, walk, push, trap, poison, heal, reverse position or even summon a werewolf against your enemies.

There are two ways to win the game:
- Killing all wizards of the opposite color by throwing them off the bridge; or
- Arriving and taking possession of the Book of Eternity, the Miraculum.

boardgame.name: Moonlight on Roseville Beach: Queer Guide for Amateur Sleuths
boardgame.description:
Head west on Rose Island and you get to the pricey summertime communities like Saltwinne, Destiny Bay, or Dunewood. Head east and you’ll find exclusive resort towns like Pinewood Harbor, Charmington, and Sunken Oak. But those city kids and artists looking to get away for a long weekend, they’re heading right out to the middle of the island for that old gaycation getaway: Roseville Beach.

In this Boardwalk & Sorcery romantic fantasy setting for Diogo Nogueira's Dark Streets & Darker Secrets, you play the amateur sleuths protecting a 1970s queer beach town from cosmic horrors, vindictive necromancers, fantastical beasts, and conservative politicians.

The beta playtest Player's Guide includes:


An introduction to Roseville Beach
Lifepath character creation
Concept ideas for each DS&DS archetype
Complications for the Roseville Beach setting
A special resource system using the DS&DS durability dice
A new power for Gifted characters: Lycanthropy


Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: DeckBones
boardgame.description:
The Whispers of Qaeos & Classic Solitaire

"The kingdoms of The Gar worked peaceably together for thousands of years, building trade, prosperity and respect ... then came Qaeos, the Dragon Queen.

Qaeos and her minions ravished the land, plundered its resources and enslaved its people, aided by allies within the ranks of the kingdoms themselves.

You have three days to outwit the forces of Qaeos, free the royals, nobles and subjects of the kingdoms, restore order, and collect your reward."

Klondike Solitaire - Unplugged



GO OFFLINE


Step away from your phone
Close your laptop
Walk away from your desktop
Ignore alerts & messages
Tune out and dive in


DeckBones let you play classic solitaire (and other card games) offline using LESS SPACE than a full-sized deck of cards, with LESS FIDDLING, flipping and aligning of slippery card stacks.


NEW lore
FUN gameplay variants
UNIQUE Insurrection expansion




FEATURES


Available in NANO tiles (3/4″ x 1/2″)(19mm x 12mm) or MICRO tiles (1-1/8″ x 3/4″) (28mm x 19mm)
Ergonomic ‘bone’ shape — easy to pick up, manouver and manipulate
Play card games in extremely tight spaces
Use anywhere — coffee shop, lap desk, brief case
Pocket-sized, light-weight

boardgame.name: Profi-Fussball
boardgame.description: Players create and manage a soccer team by moving on a track wich provides events, opportunities to buy team members and challenges with other players. Money is the essential ressource you can gain or lose according to the events. Team members may be sold by negotiation from player to player. The Player to collect all of his 11 team members and owning the most valuable Team, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Ice Floes & Foes
boardgame.description:
In Ice Floes & Foes, 2-6 players will try to save the seals and whales from the fishing boats and hunters. Shove ice floes onto the board and aim to get the fishing boats and hunters to fall off the board on the other side! Be careful not to shove the seals and whales off the board though!

Ice Floes & Foes is a fun family game for 2-6 players, age 6+, and plays in about 15-30 minutes. The goal of the game is to collect 5 points. Each fishing boat and hunter you shove off the board gets you one point. On your turn, you may shove three ice floes onto the board. But be careful, because if you shove an animal off the board, your turn ends immediately! The first player to collect a combination of 5 fishing boats and hunters ends and wins the game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fussball-Match Ein Fuballspiel fr Heimkicker
boardgame.description:
A Soccer game for 2 or 4 players. 4 players play simultaneously two 2 player games on both identical boards.

A soccer match is played by rolling one die and moving one of the 11 pawns on the tracks, eliminating the opponent pawns by requiring the same field and moving one own pawn into the opponents goal. After scoring a goal, the game is reset, every player regains his lost pawns. Play continues until the agreed time is up.

boardgame.name: Little Bus Lotto
boardgame.description:
This animal-themed lotto game features 24 animal character tiles and 4 different colored buses to choose from.

The 24 tiles are spread out face down on the table. Each bus has pictures of 6 animals riding in them. Players select a tile and try to match it to one of their pictures. If the pictures don't match, the tile is returned upside down to the table. The first player to match all his bus passengers, wins.

Whilst developing matching and memory skills, children will also love looking at the different animal characters and seeing what they are up to on the bus! This travel size game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for ages 3 - 6 years.

boardgame.name: Hot Sand, Cold Steel: The Battle of Abu Ageila June 5-6, 1967
boardgame.description:
"Toward ten o'clock I could sense an added nervousness. Commanders asked more often
Whether there were any changes." –Yael Dayan’s comments following a command meeting by Sharon and his officers early in the attack at Abu Ageila, June 5, 1967.

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is an introductory-level wargame simulation of the battle of Abu Ageila, fought in the Sinai between the Egyptian 2nd Infantry Division and elements of General Ariel Sharon’s armored Ugdah (division).

Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield. Both will be challenged to do as well, or better than their historical counterparts.

Each copy of Hot Sand, Cold Steel includes the following:

• Eighty single-sided, unmounted counters
• Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
• One Players’ Aid Sheet
• 8 pages of rules

Players will also need one six-sided die to play the game. Each hex is about three quarters of a kilometer across. A turn represents two hours of time. Each unit is either a battalion (II) or company (I).

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.

-description from designer
