boardgame.name: The Complete Curse of Roslof Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once again journey with the Company of the Ivory Scimitar a thousand miles from their home in the Free Coast to the westernmost nation within the New Kingdoms, Thalonia. There, embark on a mission to free the city's mysterious Kasbah District from an unknown magical threat that has created a new labyrinth beneath its streets. Battle against the companies of the other noble houses of the city as you attempt to be the first to conquer this new and powerful dungeon, while also trying to solve the mystery of its dark corruption (that is hauntingly similar to what occurred in Roslof Keep). Can you and your players devise a way to stave off all the threats that will present themselves? Will you win the ultimate prize, not only for yourselves, but also for the noble house that hired you, and can you free the Kasbah of this corruption before it is too late? This mega adventure includes 6 full Folio adventures and 12 mini-adventures in high level AD&D and 5E mechanics.

boardgame.name: The Folio #23
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the 3rd Level of the Kasbah Dungeon defeated, the Company of the Ivory Scimitar must once again move downward. This new level, however, has fallen to a slimy corruption that creats new and deadly obstacles beyond the monsters that lurk within. Can the characters discover the secrets of this level before they are overcome, not only by the insidious slime, but also a threat from beyond the dungeon? The intrepid adventurers will face new threats from the other banner companies in the form of dread spells, find themselves trapped below the surface, and have to find the proper key to continue on their journey downward. CRK4, Realm of the Slimes!, is a high level adventure for 1E & 5E formats and designed for 5 to 7 characters levels 12-14.

boardgame.name: The Artifacts of Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within the pages of this tome, you will find eight incredible adventures taht cover time periods from the 'magic & powder' setting, Gun Kingdoms, to the more traditional dungeons of standard fantasy. Three adventures follow the exploits of a post magical apocalyse crew as they look for lost magic and gold amid the ruins, while five other adventures say within the confines a true fantasy. Delve into a frozen dungeon, sail on magical currents between planetary spheres, and fight against the undead and dark Templars of a dread temple. These are just a few of the adventures awaiting your characters in Artifacts of Adventure. Compiled within are 6 Folio: Digital Quarterly adventures, and 3 Folio: True Level Adventure paths from Art of the Genre.

boardgame.name: Fiendish Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inpired by the classic TSR 'orange spine' hardcovers of the 1980s, this 128 page tome contains 115 new monsters that are playable in both AD&D and 5th Edition formats as well as treasure tables, climate encounter tables, monster level encounter tables, and a regional treasure table.

boardgame.name: Guidelines: Wealth, Status, and Society
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This game aid is meant to transform the tracking of character wealth from an accounting exercise that can feel rather divorced from the rest of the game, to an integrated piece of the narrative that many prefer to be the backbone of a campaign. Using this system, the Games Master and players alike might more naturally identify opportunities for further adventures and character development.

In addition to material wealth, these guidelines address related concepts of status, class, reputation, and societal organization. Building upon and synthesizing ideas and rules from core MYTHRAS, its supplements, and other sources, Wealth, Status, and Society presents a cohesive toolkit for addressing how a character fits into the larger milieu of culture and civilization in your game world.

To be clear, Wealth, Status, and Society has been crafted specifically for the MYTHRAS gaming system. Any compatibility with other systems is fortuitous. You may find some inspiration here, though.

boardgame.name: Mass Combat and Clash of Armies
Mass Combat Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Guide to manage mass combat at strategic level on hexagonal maps.

INTRODUCTION
-Rules Encylopedia
-Strategy, Tactic & Grand Tactic
-Military Campaigns
-Dice Pool
-The Steps

STRATEGIC MOVEMENT
-Hexagonal Maps
-Forced March

2.BASE FORCE
-Leadership
-Hit Points
-Equipment
-Training

BATTE UNIT RANK
-Discipline
-Experience
-Traits

BATTLE RATING
-Instances

BATTLE SCORE
-Dice Pool
-Circumstances
-Initiative
-Tactics
-Battle Roll

BATTLE OUTCOME
-Preparing for Battle
-Manage the Battle Outcome
-Immunities & Resistances
-Regenerate the Battle Unit

7.THE NAME
-Name Generator
-Name's Effects

TYPE OF BATTLE UNITS
-Experience (optional rule)
-Standard Battle Units
-Historical Battle Units

SIEGE RULES
-Attacking a Fortification
-Sieging a Fortification
-Starving the Defenders

WAR MACHINES
-Field Machines
-Siege Machines

boardgame.name: Spiders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the inaugural installment of Monster Mash. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover four different kinds of spiders. Two from other planes and two you just don’t want to meet. These spiders are Large Spider, Metallic Spider, Phase Spider and Shadow Spider.

This PDF will explain the ecology of the spider as well as listing stats for Fantasy Hero. Spiders will give your players fits in your Fantasy Hero campaign. The zip includes Hero Designer files as well.

boardgame.name: The White Queen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D. is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full time job to try and keep track of them as well as update information about the, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This is a series of small products that will introduce new villains and heroes for you campaign.

This installment will present fresh from the pages of the TPP Villain Compendium I

The White Queen, she’s a mastermind that hides the fact that she’s woman through technology. With her bodyguard/killer White Shade she’s a threat to heroes and the world. With the money to hire any villain out there she will give your players fits.

boardgame.name: Coffin Ball
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

AAW Games Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 Character Levels 14–15

The game is eternal. The stakes are your immortal souls.

An archaeological expedition attempted to excavate a recently discovered tomb, only for one mercenary escort to emerge alive, screaming of powerful undead waiting within. The party, as adventurers of great renown, have been paid a considerable fee to explore this tomb, as it could be symptomatic of a mighty force of undeath lurking below.

Little do the adventurers know that sports-obsessed Pharaoh Akhmenij is about to play the most lethal game of them all with the adventurers as participants: Coffin Ball! Will the adventurers manage to best the undefeated, undead champion of the coffin, or will they join his legion of undead reserve players for an eternity on the bank?

boardgame.name: Phoenix Draught
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Now granted, Fiery death isn't everyone's cup o' tea, but you might like this one...'

Whilst this brew steels the nerves and offers a second chance for those who fall in battle, it does so with a bang, that has a slight chance of going off early.

Rules included for 5E and system agnostic notes.

And what more fun than a front-line fighter who explodes and resurrects if they run in to trouble!

boardgame.name: There's Something Down There: Sewer Encounters for 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

People whisper in the streets that something’s living in the sewers. Not the rats. Everyone knows about them. Not the undead. You can hear them moaning from a mile away. Something … else.

In “There’s Something Down There”, you’ll get 12 .png sewer tiles you can print at home or upload to any free image editor, such as GIMP or Krita and create your own sewers. You could even load them onto Roll20 and drop them onto your map as you go.

The rollable tables will guide your placement of those tiles and offer encounters as well as creature dispositions to ensure every time you go down into these sewers, you’ll encounter something nasty and different.

We also wanted to include a tough boss, so meet the Fatberg! Those real life monstrosities are a bane to infrastructure everywhere. Now you can fight one! — but watch out, they’re huge and tough!

“There’s Something Down There” is the next in our short adventure line that we hope you can drop into your stories with flexibility and ease.

boardgame.name: Anubis Class Heavy Lifter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Anubis is good for “moving heavy things a long way”, so the owners tell us. The ship is paired with a 3000 ton Module, a heavy shuttle for moving large amounts of cargo, military stores or fuel. But the ship also carries accident investigators.

When a 2000 ton Heavy Cruiser ends up in a field with half the crew killed, someone has to go and find out why and bring the damaged ship back. What was the ship doing, what caused it to suddenly crash? Not everyone involved wants a thorough investigation to find the truth.
The Anubis supplement contains a the Anubis Class Heavy Lifter including crew details and notes on investigating accidents, statistics and deck plans for the Anubis, statistics for the Cargo/fuel and the Hospital Modules, an investigation timeline for the referee and an introductory adventure.

boardgame.name: HPS Cartography Kit
boardgame.description:
The HPS Cartography Kit is a collection of hexagon tiles for use with Hex Kit or maybe even other cartography software!

It includes over 400 tiles! Many drawn specifically for this tile set and many taken from previous Highland Paranormal Society maps!

Not only can you use these tiles to make maps for your home tabletop RPG sessions, you can make maps for your own RPG products!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hex Kit: Spaceland Part One: Space
boardgame.description:
Hex Kit: Spaceland Part One: Space is a tile set for the Hex Kit map making desktop application that suits sector and system maps for your favorite space faring RPGs. Included are over 1,100 new tile illustrations for planets, stars, anomolies, nebulae, grids, screens, warp gates, and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Wizards and Blades
boardgame.description:
An obscure fantasy adventure boardgame independently published by the designer in the 1980's.

Three players control groups of warriors seeking to plunder the treasure cavern of the "Board Master," a fourth player. Each group of warriors competes against the other groups in an attempt to steal the Board Master's treasure.

A warrior player wins by carrying the Board Master's treasure to a designated sanctuary space. The Board Master's goal is to eliminate all of the warriors. At the Board Master's disposal are three wizards, six trolls, a Golden Guardian, and an Angel of Death! Each warrior player controls four warriors. The various playing pieces are plastic figurines.

At heart, Wizards and Blades is a traditional roll-and-move style game with events and flavor provided through cards. Combat between pieces can be resolved through dice rolling or card play.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 2, Issue 18 - 2006)
boardgame.description:
The Imperial Herald
Vol. 2 / No. 18

Kotei 2006!

Path of Hope Meets Draft

All-new Card Encyclopedia
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

boardgame.name: Equatorial Clash
boardgame.description:
Equatorial Clash is a simulation of the conflict between Ecuador and Perú in July 1941. This small war was the most important clash in the long series of wars, skirmishes and border conflicts between these two countries for the regions that both considered rightfully theirs. The game is centered in the main theatre of operations in the coastal zone.

The game uses a map divided into areas and in each turn players will alternate taking “impulses” in which they can spend a certain amount of “action points” in order to move military units, launch combats, replenish depleted units and influence in political matters. The other fronts of the war are represented in a more abstract way as two tracks: one for the Macará-Loja axis and another one for the Amazonian outposts as a whole.

—description from the designer

boardgame.description:
The Imperial Herald

Results from the World Championships

Rise of the Shogun Encyclopedia

boardgame.name: Sushi Do
boardgame.description: Players offer trades by crying out the number of cards they want to swap (“One! One! One!”, or “Three! Three! Three!”) but not their sushi flavor. The winner of the hand is the first to collect all of one flavor (6 cards), declaring “Sushi Do!”. The winner of the hand scores points equal to the value of the flavor, and the winner of the game is the first to 500 points.

boardgame.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 2, Issue 21 - 2006)
boardgame.description:
The Imperial Herald
Vol. 2 / No. 21

Samurai Edition

Race for the Throne

boardgame.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 2, Issue 22 - 2007)
boardgame.description:
The Imperial Herald
Vol. 2 / No. 22

Samurai Edition

boardgame.name: Trick Shot: Neoprene Game Board
boardgame.description: This oversized neoprene game board creates a larger and softer playing surface for your games of Trick Shot.

boardgame.name: Salon de Paris
boardgame.description:
As the sun radiates through the window and illuminates your work of art, you load the next color into your brush as you mentally paint the canvas with your inspiration. After many hours of work, you sign your next masterpiece and prepare it for the next show in the salon. Gathering ideas at the café, following art critics, and through teachings at the art institute, you claw your way into becoming the most famous artist in the Salon de Paris.

Salon de Paris is an action selection game for 1 to 4 players that plays in 45 to 75 minutes. Players are artist who are moving throughout Paris to acquire canvases at the market, teach at the academy, gain inspiration at the café, paint their paintings at the studio, interact with the art critics, and finally hang their masterpiece on the salon wall. Positioning of a painting on the salon wall will earn players victory points, as well as, matching what the art critics are seeking. As more paintings are completed, the player's reputation will further increase the player's reputation resulting in additional victory points and unique player powers granted by the academy.

When the wall is mostly filled with paintings, the game will end and the player who has earned the most victory points will be deemed the best painter.

-description from developer

boardgame.name: Path of Exile 2
boardgame.description: Path of Exile 2 is a new seven-act storyline that is available alongside the original Path of Exile 1 campaign. Both the old and new storyline lead to the same shared Atlas endgame. Path of Exile 2 retains all expansion content that has been created over the last six years and introduces a new skill system, ascendancy classes, engine improvements and more.

boardgame.name: Suits & Daggers
boardgame.description:
Players are assigned secret Statuses at the beginning of the game, deeming them either an Employee or Influencer. Influencers can deflect Sabotages and add bonus points to Collaboration, but using either power exposes their Status and Status cards are shuffled and redealt.

To earn points, players complete their assigned Objective cards by gathering the necessary Work cards into their hand. Without the right cards, players can still try to earn points by either “Slacking” (bluffing about having the right cards), or by collaborating with other players to complete Objectives-- selecting a partner who claims to have the cards you need and pooling resources to fulfill your objective.

Watch out though-- collaborating with the wrong player might mean getting Sabotaged (when your partner gives you any card(s) other than what you need), but collaborating with the right player (specifically, an Influencer) leads to seven (7) additional bonus points for the completed objective.

Some Work cards are also Undercut cards-- attacks that players can use against their peers. Players can use up to two Undercuts on other players at the end of their turn.

Sabotaging an Influencer by accident results in losing points, so be careful who you target! Regular Employees can also block Undercuts if they have an elusive Water Cooler card in hand at the time of an attempted attack.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Blackbrim: 1876
boardgame.description:
Set during the Victorian era in the English town of Blackbrim, you are a private detective who has received a package containing mysterious clues from a police commissioner shortly before he was kidnapped. He and the entire police force are being held hostage. To save them, you must solve all the riddles the perpetrator left behind…

Blackbrim: 1876 contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun. It's like two escape room or mystery games with one single purchase.

boardgame.name: La Famiglia
boardgame.description:
May 20, 1929—It’s the Roaring Twenties! The economy is booming, and new technologies such as the automobile and electricity are now mainstream. Alcohol is still flowing freely, even though Prohibition has banned its consumption. As a result, the mafia’s profits have been soaring from sales of their illegal bootleg liquor, and violent crime is also on the rise.

Al Capone, Chicago’s infamous mafia boss, was just arrested, but there’s more to the story. You receive a request for help from the FBI for their investigation into a gang called La Famiglia who might be even more dangerous than Capone’s Chicago Outfit gang. Can you crack the case?

La Famiglia contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun. It's like two escape room or mystery games with one single purchase.

listing.notes: weight: 144 grams + packaging

boardgame.name: The Devil's Advocate (Ed. 2 - 1982)
boardgame.description:
The Devil's Advocate

Ed. 2
1982

boardgame.name: Jolly Tumbler
boardgame.description: A victorian game of skill. Players try to roll their oblong tumbler into the hole for the highest points without losing it off the board.

boardgame.name: Emojito Party Game
Emojito Party!
Emojito! Party
boardgame.description:
Emojito Party! provides big emotions in a practical travel format. As in the classic game EMOJITO!, players have to express emotions that are specified on the game cards: the bored, arrogant cat, the nasty fish or the frenetic, overwound alarm clock. You think that's easy? Then play Emojito Party and find out how well you are able to realize and recognize emotions. You can play Emojito Party! as an independent game, or add its cards as a complement to the classic party game EMOJITO!. Give your emotions free rein!

—description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Pixie
boardgame.description: A dexterity game where players throw marbles and try to be the first to 10,000 points.

boardgame.name: Tenable
boardgame.description:
Based on ITV's "Top 10" quiz Tenable, this board game brings you a fun and challenging adaptation of the TV show featuring questions and gameplay that will make you fill like you're taking part in the studio.

A team of players attempt to earn money by correctly guessing items in a list of ten.

The chosen team captain selects a teammate to answer the question for each round, and then play the final question themselves. In each round, one chosen player tries to give as many correct answers as they can for a category with ten items. Each answer earns money, and a player may stop and bank what they have at five correct answers. Banked money goes into the final jackpot for the bonus round.

To help, a team gets one life per round (in case they give a wrong answer), as well as one “Overrule”, where the team captain can reject a given answer and substitute another one. These can be used once per round, with the Overrule only allowed prior to five correct answers. The final help is three “Nominate” tokens, which are used among all players. With them, the player may chose another player to give an answer if they can’t think of one. Players get eliminated if they give a second wrong answer and are sent to the Vortex.

When all players have played a question, the final round begins. Any player who banked money and was not eliminated participates. If no player remained in the game, 500 is put into the bank and the captain plays solo. The team is given a choice of two lists to play, and they begin giving answers one at a time, in turn. A wrong answer eliminates a player. If the tenth answer is given, any remaining players split the money. If everyone is eliminated prior to getting all ten answers, the player who banked the most money in the previous rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Game of Spin'em
boardgame.description: Players set a top spinning in the center of the board. If the top starts a spinner to move, player scores the points shown. Player with the highest total wins.

boardgame.name: Phrase Maze
boardgame.description:
Players try to exit the maze board by answering clue cards that have rhyming answers. There are four categories available for play: Their Flair (People), Sports Shorts (Sports), Creature Feature (Animal) and Hodge Podge (Variety). Each card contains four numbered clues which determine how far a playing piece may move (e.g. - answering clue #3 means a player can move three spaces). There are three sub-categories in the game: Think Wink, Thinky Winky and Thinkety Winkety. These designate two-word answers of one, two or three syllables per word, respectively. However, since Thinkety Winkety cards are harder, they are treated as Wild cards that allow for moving five spaces on the board.

When a player gives an answer, opponents may either pass or challenge the answer. While there is one answer per clue, it is possible to have more than one correct answer. If a player passes, they accept the given answer. If they challenge, they consult the Challenge Card and check the answer given. If the answers don’t match, it’s an automatic wrong answer. Once a team is correct, they can move their piece the number of spaces the clue stated, or they may hinder opponents by moving their piece farther from the exit. Moves are also not limited to completely one direction. For example, a move of three could be played as two backwards and one to the left.

The first player or team to get their piece to the exit on the opposite side where they started, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Party Freud
boardgame.description:
A new card game for people who probably need therapy and who love to laugh. (Ahem, everyone!)

Take turns playing "Doc" as players prescribe and treat some modern day ailments with comical solutions. Strengthen your funny bones and see who's the best at helping one another get through life.

The dealer (AKA the “Doc”) starts by dealing each player seven Freud cards. The Doc then draws a Party card and reads it aloud. The Party card will present a modern day ailment.

Players then choose from a range of fake treatment options through the Freud cards and toss them into a pile. The Doc then reads the fake treatment options aloud and chooses their favorite prescription. Plus, our Group Therapy prompts are hidden within the Party cards.

Group Therapy activities include:

Symptom Charades: Using the rules of charades, players act out a range of mood related ailments.
Rapid Response: Similar to categories, players shout out words to fit within a certain category.
Diagnose a Friend: Players identify who amongst the group fits a certain description.
Head Talk: The Doc places a card on their for head and players shout out clues as fast as possible to compete for the most helpful assistant.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Soft-Core Pornography Game
boardgame.description:
Two teams of two players each try to match answers to personal questions, with matching answers given the the opportunity to choose a “Lewd Language” card to place on their game board. Each board contains a phrase with blanks in it numbered 1-6. The blanks filled in after each question are determined by the number printed on the card. Each card also has a point value on it, with more points given for dirtier words.

In lieu of drawing a new card, players may also choose to trade a card they already have for a new one. They do this in the hopes of getting a higher point value on their card. There are also Censored and Socially Redeeming Cards in each deck. Censored cards are used to cover one of the opponent’s words, thereby blocking out scoring points, and the Socially Redeeming cards are used to remove a Censored card if one has been placed.

The player or team who creates the highest scoring sentence on their game card wins.

boardgame.name: Scarred Lands Spell Cards
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Whether you are a player or a GM, you can enhance your Scarred Lands game with this set of spell cards! Every spell from the Scarred Lands Player's Guide (5th edition) is included in this deck of cards. Lay them out next to your sheet during play for quick, easy reference to all your character's Scarred Lands spells.

boardgame.name: Bunkers & Badasses Hardcover Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
Based on the game-within-a-game from Gearbox Entertainment's Borderlands series, Bunkers & Badasses is tabletop roleplaying unlike anyone’s ever done before!

Within the Sourcebook, you’ll find over 200 pages of skag-shooting, skeleton-looting, treasure-hoarding tabletop action!

https://nerdvanagames.myshopify.com/products/bunkers-badasse...

boardgame.name: Bunkers & Badasses Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Based on the game-within-a-game from Gearbox Entertainment's Borderlands series, Bunkers & Badasses is tabletop roleplaying unlike anyone’s ever done before!

Within the Sourcebook, you’ll find over 200 pages of skag-shooting, skeleton-looting, treasure-hoarding tabletop action!

boardgame.name: Quests: Heroes of Sorcado
boardgame.description:
Quests: Heroes of Sorcado is an epic fantasy cooperative campaign for 1-6 players. In each of eight adventures (plus a bonus training adventure) you'll build your character, acquiring powerful spells and weapons, and increasing your abilities by defeating monsters, evading traps, and forging your path through choice-driven events, traps, and side quests.

Add up your Hero's character, weapon, and magic bonuses, and roll dice for damage against fearsome foes, with each Adventure culminating in a boss fight that will require all your best items, potions, abilities, and a bit of luck. With a 60+ page campaign story and 140+ pages of additional story events and choices, players can immerse themselves in a world beset by a demon lord bent on total destruction. Choose your destiny, hone your weapons, and find out if you have what it takes to save Sorcado from utter destruction at the hands of the Dark Lord.



-=-=-=-

You can try the Demo/Prequel adventure on TableTop Simulator : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=24353...

boardgame.name: Schema - Iteration 7
boardgame.description:
Schema is in the beta stage of a new iteration - think of this as an edition change, complete with draft, alpha, beta, and release stages. The changes are compiled from fully tested material - it's only the document that needs polishing up to spec. Comments are active for this document, and if you've got any to give, I'm very interested!


Schema is a light engine for tabletop roleplaying with complex stakes.

Breaking that down - It is an engine, rather than a game, because assembly is required - you'll need to provide a setting and do a bit of configuring before it's ready to go. It's an engine with complex stakes - the kind of thing you might see in a Powered by the Apocalypse game, but built on the fly with a "stakes sheet" in the center of the table.

boardgame.name: You Wouldn't Last One Minute On The Creek
boardgame.description:
I was once watching a certain beloved show about a sentient creek. When I brought it up at work, someone mocked me. I quickly shouted at them "YOU WOULDN'T LAST ONE MINUTE ON THE CREEK". This brewed in my skull for years.. Now I offer you a TROIKA! compatible version of this experience. So uh.. roll up a character with the background of choice.

This is a cosmic dread simulator, that could also function as a funnel. Maybe you're playing a game and you need a duel and someone shouts "YOU WOULDN'T LAST ONE MINUTE ON THE CREEK"... ya.. now u kno what will happen.

You could also use it as a quick way to level up your TROIKA! characters.

It's also totally functional as a 1 player game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Warlock - A Dungeon World Playbook
boardgame.description:
Voted by the damned as the funnest way to sell your soul, this Warlock playbook for Dungeon World has over 25 entirely new alignments, backgrounds, bonds, and racial, starting, and advanced moves. This playbook focuses on cantrips, curses, and weird abilities that accurately reflect your supernatural patron, focused around a book of incantations given to you by your master.

Evolve from there into a cunning illusionist, a psionic master, or a fearsome warrior with a cursed blade, zealously serving your patron!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Bubblegum Wizards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the world of Bubblegum Wizards, magic power comes from the flavors found in corner-store bubblegum, and spells come from collectable foil cards. You play someone (probably one of these such wizards, but I'm not your mom, I can't tell you what to do) with something to prove in the big city full of magic, cool cars, bikes, and bubblegum.

Bubblegum Wizards is a TTRPG with (usually) 1 game master (or Clerk), and up to 6 players. These books contain, but are certainly not limited to:


48 unique and versatile spells.
Sensical, fun mechanics for colliding objects as damage. Why walk up and hit someone with a bat when you could throw them off the train?
Robust yet easy chase and battle mechanics for all of your fast-paced action needs.
A selection of fictional magazines for your character to read.
A selection of unique transportation options for your character to make use of.
A nice little character sheet just for you.


All these coming in the 3 files that constitute this purchase:


Bubblegum Wizards, the core rule book (15 pages)
The list of spells/foil cards and their abilities (8 pages)
A printable character sheet (1 page)

boardgame.name: Manly, Brawling Lawyers of Justice!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are Manly, Brawling Lawyers and you love JUSTICE!!! Use your words, your looks and your fists to MAKE JUSTICE HAPPEN! Your Lawyer can be of, and present as, any gender but must accept Manliness as their way of life!

This is not a realistic Courtroom. It’s one-half sexy legal drama, one-quarter competitive sports and one-quarter gameshow. Don’t let logic, shame, physics or knowledge of actual court proceedings hold you back!

You and the other Players will invent the facts in a court case and argue for the side of JUSTICE, Manly, Brawling Lawyer style! You will be guided by the JUSTICE Master, (JM), who will create the initial setup, flesh out the details of the setting, play all the characters you encounter and ensure that the wicked Opposition give you a run for your money!

Seduce the opposition. Make legal declarations entirely through the language of flexing. Smash chairs over your opponents' heads. Dance for JUSTICE!

Watch out for invading kaiju, heavily armed judges and murderous robotic juries!

This is straightforward mini-RPG in under 40 pages. The basics are easy to learn but there are enough options and extra bits to give you some tactical depth as you use grunts and slapping to charge yourself with MAN-energy or perform a gavotte so sensual it causes an opposing lawyer to faint.

Includes GM advice and safety tools.

boardgame.name: Trespassers of the Full Moon Tower (DCC)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adventure zine for 2-4 adventurers level 1-2, compatible with DCC RPG!

In the deep woods just outside of Middleport, there stands the Full Moon Tower. In the days when the tower was new, children from Middleport began to disappear in the dead of night.

The villagers tracked the missing children to the tower, but not a single one was to be found inside. Only a beautiful woman, a witch, who would not tell where the children had gone.

Generations have passed since the children left. Still, the villagers do not go near the tower, for none have entered it and returned.

This adventure is intended as a side quest or random hexcrawl encounter, especially if one party member will be absent for several sessions. Have that player's PC abducted by bandits. The remaining players must then reckon with the witch who haunts the tower and demands the bandits bring her fresh victims.

The dungeon design is simple (essentially a one-page tower dungeon), but features plenty of room for player choice, and for some very big mistakes.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Trespassers of the Full Moon Tower (OSR)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An adventure zine for 2-4 adventurers level 1-2, compatible with the Basic/Expert rules of OSE!

In the deep woods just outside of Middleport, there stands the Full Moon Tower. In the days when the tower was new, children from Middleport began to disappear in the dead of night.

The villagers tracked the missing children to the tower, but not a single one was to be found inside. Only a beautiful woman, a witch, who would not tell where the children had gone.

Generations have passed since the children left. Still, the villagers do not go near the tower, for none have entered it and returned.

This adventure is intended as a side quest or random hexcrawl encounter, especially if one party member will be absent for several sessions. Have that player's PC abducted by bandits. The remaining players must then reckon with the witch who haunts the tower and demands the bandits bring her fresh victims.

The dungeon design is simple (essentially a one-page tower dungeon), but features plenty of room for player choice, and for some very big mistakes.

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon 2
boardgame.description:
Darkest Dungeon II is about hope, grit and determination. It reminds us that in times of crisis, we can’t wait for salvation, we have to find it ourselves – earn it, in spite of our weaknesses.

Our familiar companions band together for another journey into oblivion – this time in stylized 3d! In fact, this teaser was captured straight out of Unity, and uses the in-game character models and rendering techniques from the game itself. With a refined combat system and a whole new metagame, Darkest Dungeon II is packed with fresh monsters, bosses, and challenges.

boardgame.name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Tardigrade Wanderer Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Munchkin CCG TCG Tardigrade Wanderer Promo DeSouza Art Free RPG Day Exclusive.

Hero Card.

DESCRIPTION:
Zap – Move 1 card from your discard pile to the bottom of your deck.

listing.notes:
New. Card will be in a sleeve. From a smoke-free home.
For Canadian residents, I'll accept Interac e-transfers to save on fees. For US and International residents, I'll accept PayPal.
Buyer pays shipping. I'll get a quote with shipping costs and options. If you would like more images, let me know and I'll send them to you.

boardgame.name: Machu Picchu Mystery
boardgame.description: Explore the ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu in search of the lost tomb of emperor Pachacuti in this at-home escape room.

boardgame.name: Washington DC Mystery
boardgame.description: Explore the city of Washington DC, exploring the nation's monuments and museum as you track down a secret society and stop their evil plans in this at-home escape room.

boardgame.name: Freeform Skirmish Referee
boardgame.description:
Freeform Skirmish Referee is a wargame where two or more players are in control of a force of combat focused units.

The players give the orders for their units to an adjudicating referee who interprets the outcomes of these orders in the game world.

The referee then presents these outcomes to the players.

It is different from most wargames in that the players do not need to know any of the rules of the game (in fact there are none - the entire game depends on the adjudication of the referee).

The players simply need to know what type of fighting force they would like to play and to tell the adjudicating referee the actions they would like that force to take.

Guidelines are presented in this PDF for running the game, creating units, providing orders and adjudicating turns.

Additionally, d6 tables for action resolution and a page of sample units are provided.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tome of Rites and Rituals Vol.1
boardgame.description:
Most know of magic, and many will know a few small spells that help them through daily life - perhaps a ritual to ease a fever, or a rite to keep a drink warm. Dear reader, as you will learn from these pages, the world of magic is much more fundamental to society than these mundane cantrips.

The Tome of Rites and Rituals is a roleplay aid designed to help spice up tabletop settings, grant inspiration to creatives, and provide an entertaining window into a fantasy world. The tome contains descriptions of 8 spells in the form of instructions, as well as a glossary for fictional plants, elements, drinks, and creatures mentioned therein.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Tomb of George DiMaggio
boardgame.description:
The tomb of a fallen paladin lies hidden in the forest. Guarded now by his undead comrades who served under him before his fall from grace.

Many have tried to get into his tomb but as yet none have returned. It is said the tomb contains many books containing knowledge of rare magic items & bountiful treasures.

Some say George DiMaggio is still there as a living undead unable to leave his prison of a Tomb. Other say he still walking the earth and tomb contains the secrets to eternal life.

This adventure was designed to be run in 1-2 sessions and provide and opportunity to drop hooks or reveal secrets to new or existing campaigns. As always hack and extend to your hearts content.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The NPC With a Thousand Faces
boardgame.description:
It's happened to all of us: the players decide to speak to an NPC you didn't prepare for. The most you have is a name and maybe even a race -- but you're drawing blanks! Who is this barkeep? What do they really want in life? What are their struggles?

The NPC With a Thousand Faces is a technique I've built to generate NPCs from my over 17 years of running Tabletop Games with a menagerie of systems. It's Fast! It's Flexible! It's Focused! It's Table-Tested!

Rescue yourself from those awkward moments that threaten to pull players out of the experience -- or hand the book over to them to assist them rolling up a fascinating new character that goes beyond a sheet with a class and lists of equipment and powers.

Included in this 24 Page Supplement:

The 1000 Faces Technique
48 fast, d100-based, tables that make rolling up a complex character a snap
Blistering fast, diceless (because sometimes you don't want players to know you haven't rolled this NPC up), tables inspired by Bantam Books' Choose your own Adventure Series' Diceless Random Rolls to help you instantly add depth.
100 pre-rolled NPCs Traits customized for a variety of genres! (Fantasy, Sci-fi, Western, Eastern, and Horror)

boardgame.name: Belote Junior
boardgame.description:
Discover the famous belote games in its Junior version!

With 4 game rules to learn Belote and its variants!
Let your children discover the games of your childhood!
From 6 years old. From 2 to 6 players.

boardgame.name: The Harvest - 5e Adventure
boardgame.description:
The village of Denner's Mill is gearing up for the annual Harvest Festival when disaster strikes. Crop circles, mysterious fires, and malevolent ravens--it will take a few brave heroes to uncover the truth and restore peace to the village.

The Harvest is a fall-themed adventure for 1st-level 5e characters geared toward players who are new to tabletop RPGs. Features a good blend of combat, exploration and roleplaying with a gentle learning curve.

This adventure is compliant with the Open Game License.

You'll receive a 10-page document with stat blocks, maps, and a puzzle activity. The vertical layout is best for digital reading, while the print layout is intended for printing double-sided and assembling into a zine!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: New Phone, Who Dis?: First Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack is full of ridiculous new Inbox + Reply Cards to add to New Phone, Who Dis? Core Game.

Players rotate drawing a sent (or “inbox”) card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest “reply” card. Once everyone has played their chosen reply card, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one. The player with the most points at the end of the round takes the crown.

Includes 45 Inbox cards and 135 reply cards to be added to the main game.

boardgame.name: Pictures: XL Fotos
boardgame.description:
Contains 96 large cards (111 x 79 mm):
• 91 cards with the 182 photos of the original game
• 4 cards with 8 photos themed on games
• 1 card with a variant for experienced players
The photos are over 60% larger by their surface.

Note: A copy of the base game is required as this is only cards and does not come with the other components necessary for play.

listing.notes: Title: Pictures XL Fotos Publisher: PD-Verlag Language(s): English German

boardgame.name: Gem Wizards Tactics
boardgame.description: Steam description - Can you stop the Business Demons from fracking & burning your lands to the ground? Test your skills in the bumpiest, bounciest tactics game EVER MADE! Gem Wizards Tactics is a 1P turn-based tactics game with randomly generated maps and strange asymmetrical factions!

boardgame.name: Colony Siege
boardgame.description: Steam description - Colony Siege combines the best of RTS and tower defense, including base building, mazing, and unit physics. Defend Earth's remaining colonies using an arsenal of deadly weapons to torch, slice, throw, and impale swarms of alien invaders.

boardgame.name: Everhood
boardgame.description: Steam description - An UNCONVENTIONAL ADVENTURE RPG that takes place in an inexpressible world filled with amusing musical battles and strange delightful encounters. To put it simply: You are in for a ride.

boardgame.name: Show Me The Monet
boardgame.description:
Think Go Fish, with a classical art theme and deeper strategy.

To start the game, players are dealt four cards face down. The remaining cards are placed face down into a draw pile. On a player's turn, they ask another player if they have an artist card (e.g do you have a piece by Van Gogh?). The player they're asking then has two options. They can either say yes and give the other player their Van Gogh cards, or say no, either truthfully or in an attempt to bluff. As this game involves bluffing, if a player does not believe their opponent is telling the truth when they say they do not have a card by the named artist, they can challenge their opponent. If their opponent did have any cards by the named artist, the opponent loses a turn and has to give all cards by the named artist to the person who challenged them, and the person who challenged them takes another turn. If the challenge fails, the person who made the challenge must give the person they challenged all their cards by the named artist and the turn then passes to the left.

When a player builds a complete collection (four cards by the same artist, by artists from the same country, in the same genre, or by female artists), they place those cards on the table face up, these cards form your collection. If when doing this a player runs out of cards in their hand, they draw four new cards from the draw pile. Play continues until the draw pile is empty and all cards are placed into collections, or no more collections can be formed from the cards left in player's hands.

At the end of the game, players add up the value of their collection, taking into account any end game and wild card bonuses. The player who has the most expensive collection wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

boardgame.name: Trending Kittens
boardgame.description:
The popularity of the world's kittens is in jeopardy, so they decide to disguise themselves as other more fashionable creatures in an attempt to regain their appeal. In this original, exciting and highly addictive game, your aim is to become top cat, by maximizing your visibility and concealing your opponents. Become the world's top trending kitten!

Trending kittens is a tile game where you have to place your tiles on the table in order to flip the tiles of the other players upside down and yours facing up. At the end of the game, the one with the most tiles facing up will be the winning cat.

In addition, once during the game, you can use your clan power, making the game much more fun and difficult for your opponents.

Will you be the most "trendy" cat?

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Witch Spring 3
Witch Spring 3 Re:Fine
Witch Spring 3 Re:Fine - The Story of Eirudy, the Marionette Witch
WitchSpring3 Re:fine The Story of Eirudy
3 Re:Fine
boardgame.description:
Witch Spring 3 Set on the continent of Derkarr, a neighboring continent to Vavelia (the setting of the previous two games), the game's events are concurrent to Pieberry and Luna's story. This story follows a deity named Eirudy, who lives in seclusion in the dangerous Misty Forest with only dolls to accompany her. Longing to make real friends, she one day meets a Human boy and her life completely changes...

Witch Spring 3 Re:Fine The enchanting adventure of Eirudy offers an exciting and captivating storyline, which players won’t want to put down. The turn-based battle system and the individual characters that develop over time make the game a really beautiful adventure. With Japanese voice actors, and text fully localized into English, the game is a stand-alone title in the Witch Spring Universe. It comes with new visuals and sound, very cute art style and loveable characters. And thanks to individual storyline choices resulting in different endings and varied battle tactics, the game is worth playing through more than once. A must have for RPG fans!

boardgame.name: Witch Spring 2
Witch Spring2
boardgame.description: The game is set parallel to the first game, told from Luna's perspective rather than Pieberry's. It expands on the betrayals that made Luna the bitter deity that Pieberry met, further explains the relations between various deities, and introduces some elements that were answered in Witch Spring 3.

boardgame.name: Witch Spring
Witch Spring: Illustration Remaster
boardgame.description: The story follows Pieberry, a young deity on the continent of Vavelia. Having lived in seclusion her whole life, she decides to venture out into the world and unravels a plot far greater than she ever imagined... maybe.

boardgame.name: Witch Spring 4
Witch Spring4
boardgame.description: The game is set on the Ürphea Continent, after the Witch Hunts of the previous three games have concluded. It follows up on a plot thread revealed in Witch Spring 3's post-game. The new protagonist is Moccamori (), the current queen of Ürphea. Having suppressed the Spring War on the continent and becoming queen, she now seeks to conquer the remaining two continents.

boardgame.name: Shadow of Witch Marionette
boardgame.description: The game immediately follows up on the Witch Spring 4 post-game event "The Shadow World." Eirudy is the main protagonist again, entering the Shadow World and meeting her shadows.
